title: Observable symptoms and underlying issues

symptoms.name: Speech Delay or Lack of Speech
symptoms.notes: Speech issues can be caused or exacerbated by various underlying medical issues.

causes.name: Vitamin and/or Mineral Deficiencies
details: Other vitamin and nutrient deficiencies (B6, 5MTHF, B1, creatine, L-Carnitine, CoQ10, sulfur-rich compounds, magnesium, iron, butyrate)

symptoms.name: Developmental Delays
symptoms.notes: Delays in gross/fine motor, socialization, communication, or cognitive skills; investigate underlying reasons.

causes.name: Retained primitive reflexes (asymmetrical tonic neck reflex)

symptoms.name: Sleep Problems
symptoms.notes: Common in autism; addressing root causes can be life-changing.

causes.name: Gastrointestinal issues
details: Overgrowth of fungus or pathogenic bacteria in the gut

causes.name: Vitamin and/or Mineral Deficiencies
details: Need for magnesium, potassium, or other minerals

symptoms.name: Irritability / Aggression / Meltdowns
symptoms.notes: Behavior can reflect underlying medical causes; identify and treat root contributors.

causes.name: Low levels of vitamins and minerals
Chronic underlying infection (Strep, Lyme, Lyme co-infections)
Lead or other heavy metal toxicity

symptoms.name: Anxiety / OCD
symptoms.notes: Common in autism; multiple treatable contributors may relieve symptoms.

causes.name: Gastrointestinal issues
details: Overgrowth of pathogenic bacteria in the gut

causes.name: Poor adrenal function and norepinephrine regulation

symptoms.name: Sensory Processing Issues (SPD)
symptoms.notes: Over- or under-sensitivity to sensory input; various biological contributors.

causes.name: Gastrointestinal issues
details: Pathogenic bacterial overgrowth in the gut

symptoms.name: Toe Walking
symptoms.notes: Often attributed to SPD, but other causes may contribute.

symptoms.name: Stimming (Self-stimulatory behavior)
symptoms.notes: May be self-soothing; can also reflect medical contributors.

symptoms.name: Picky Eating (Selective Eating)
symptoms.notes: Addressing causes can reduce anxiety and improve nutrition.

symptoms.name: Pica
symptoms.notes: Eating/chewing non-food items; causes may also be consequences.

symptoms.name: Hyperlexia
symptoms.notes: Above-normal reading with below-normal spoken-language comprehension.

causes.name: Hemispheric imbalance (one side stronger than the other)

symptoms.name: Hypotonia (Low Muscle Tone)
symptoms.notes: Low baseline muscle tension/resistance; often accompanied by reduced strength.

symptoms.name: Inattention or Lack of Focus
symptoms.notes: Common and sometimes remediable by addressing underlying contributors.

causes.name: Fungal or bacterial overgrowth in the gut
Retained primitive reflexes (Moro reflex for impulse control)

usage_notes: This KB is designed to help the Lead Investigator map observable symptoms to testable hypotheses.
Always prioritize safety flags (seizures, regression, severe GI) over other concerns.
Look for cross-cutting patterns where one root cause explains multiple symptom clusters.
Modifiability ratings: High = can be tested and treated relatively easily; Moderate = requires specialist; Low = limited treatment options.
This is not diagnostic; it generates hypotheses for clinician review.
